rules

Class RuleSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • rules.RuleSet

  • public class RuleSet
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a set of rules that determines the new state of a given cell for each generation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RuleSet(java.lang.String name, StateRange[] surviveStateRanges, StateRange[] birthStateRanges)
      Constructor accepting an array of ranges where an alive cell will survive on, as well as an array of ranges where a dead cell will come to life.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Getter for the rule set's name.
      State getNewState(State currentState, int numNeighbors)
      Evaluates the new state of a given cell in the coming generation based on the cell's current state as well as the contained ranges.
      java.lang.String getRuleString()
      Getter for the rule set's rule string.
      boolean isEqual(java.lang.String otherRuleString)
      Compares this rule set's rule string with the passed rule string and determined whether they represent the same set of rules.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RuleSet

        public RuleSet(java.lang.String name,
               StateRange[] surviveStateRanges,
               StateRange[] birthStateRanges)
        Constructor accepting an array of ranges where an alive cell will survive on, as well as an array of ranges where a dead cell will come to life.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of this rule set.
        surviveStateRanges - Ranges where an alive cell remains alive.
        birthStateRanges - Ranges where a dead cell comes to life.

    • Method Detail

      • isEqual

        public boolean isEqual(java.lang.String otherRuleString)
        Compares this rule set's rule string with the passed rule string and determined whether they represent the same set of rules.
        Parameters:
        otherRuleString - Other rule set's string to compare against.
        Returns:
        True if both rule sets represent the same rules, false otherwise.

      • getNewState

        public State getNewState(State currentState,
                         int numNeighbors)
        Evaluates the new state of a given cell in the coming generation based on the cell's current state as well as the contained ranges.
        Parameters:
        currentState - Current state of the cell before the coming generation.
        numNeighbors - Number of neighbors the cell currently has.
        Returns:
        The new state of the cell.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Getter for the rule set's name.
        Returns:
        The name of the rule set.

      • getRuleString

        public java.lang.String getRuleString()
        Getter for the rule set's rule string.
        Returns:
        Rule string representing the states for this rule set.
